Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Cryoneurolysis for Chronic Knee Osteoarthritis Pain

Participants.evidence: 87 patients with chronic knee osteoarthritis were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either cryoneurolysis or a sham procedure

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryoneurolysis in reducing pain intensity

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in average pain at 14 days post-intervention

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: blinding included patients and outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: 87 patients with chronic knee osteoarthritis were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: mean difference = 0.49; 95% CI, â€“0.3 to 1.2; P = 0.198

Harms.evidence: Minor, transient adverse effects were reported

Funding.evidence: Supported by the Danish Rheumatism Association and the Danish Health Authority
